info.title: Azure Database Migration Service Resource Provider
info.description: The Database Migration Service helps people migrate their data from on-premise database servers to Azure, or from older database software to newer software. The service manages one or more workers that are joined to a customer's virtual network, which is assumed to provide connectivity to their databases. To avoid frequent updates to the resource provider, database migration tasks are implemented by the resource provider in a generic way as task resources, each of which has a task type (which identifies the type of work to run), input, and output. The client is responsible for providing appropriate task type and inputs, which will be passed through unexamined to the machines that implement the functionality, and for understanding the output, which is passed back unexamined to the client.

get.description: The skus action returns the list of SKUs that DMS supports.

AuthenticationType.description: An enumeration of possible authentication types when connecting

MigrationValidationOptions.description: Types of validations to run after the migration

enableSchemaValidation.description: Allows to compare the schema information between source and target.

enableDataIntegrityValidation.description: Allows to perform a checksum based data integrity validation between source and target for the selected database / tables .

enableQueryAnalysisValidation.description: Allows to perform a quick and intelligent query analysis by retrieving queries from the source database and executes them in the target. The result will have execution statistics for executions in source and target databases for the extracted queries.

MigrateSqlServerSqlDbDatabaseInput.description: Database specific information for SQL to Azure SQL DB migration task inputs

targetDatabaseName.description: Name of target database. Note: Target database will be truncated before starting migration.

makeSourceDbReadOnly.description: Whether to set database read only before migration

tableMap.description: Mapping of source to target tables

MigrateSqlServerSqlDbTaskInput.description: Input for the task that migrates on-prem SQL Server databases to Azure SQL Database

validationOptions.description:
Options for enabling various post migration validations. Available options, 
 1.) Data Integrity Check: Performs a checksum based comparison on source and target tables after the migration to ensure the correctness of the data. 
 2.) Schema Validation: Performs a thorough schema comparison between the source and target tables and provides a list of differences between the source and target database, 3.) Query Analysis: Executes a set of queries picked up automatically either from the Query Plan Cache or Query Store and execute them and compares the execution time between the source and target database.

ProjectTaskProperties.description: Base class for all types of DMS task properties. If task is not supported by current client, this object is returned.

errors.description: Array of errors. This is ignored if submitted.

etag.description: HTTP strong entity tag value. This is ignored if submitted.

name.description: The unique name of the SKU, such as 'P3'

tier.description: The tier of the SKU, such as 'Free', 'Basic', 'Standard', or 'Premium'

family.description: The SKU family, used when the service has multiple performance classes within a tier, such as 'A', 'D', etc. for virtual machines

size.description: The size of the SKU, used when the name alone does not denote a service size or when a SKU has multiple performance classes within a family, e.g. 'A1' for virtual machines

capacity.description: The capacity of the SKU, if it supports scaling

DataMigrationServiceProperties.description: Properties of the Data Migration service instance

publicKey.description: The public key of the service, used to encrypt secrets sent to the service

virtualSubnetId.description: The ID of the Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/subnets resource to which the service should be joined

etag.description: HTTP strong entity tag value. Ignored if submitted

kind.description: The resource kind. Only 'vm' (the default) is supported.

NameAvailabilityRequest.description: A resource type and proposed name

creationTime.description: UTC Date and time when project was created

ServiceOperation.description: Description of an action supported by the Database Migration Service

name.description: The fully qualified action name, e.g. Microsoft.DataMigration/services/read

nextLink.description: URL to load the next page of actions

Quota.description: Describes a quota for or usage details about a resource

currentValue.description: The current value of the quota. If null or missing, the current value cannot be determined in the context of the request.

id.description: The resource ID of the quota object

limit.description: The maximum value of the quota. If null or missing, the quota has no maximum, in which case it merely tracks usage.

localizedValue.description: The localized name of the quota

value.description: The unlocalized name (or ID) of the quota

unit.description: The unit for the quota, such as Count, Bytes, BytesPerSecond, etc.

nextLink.description: URL to load the next page of quotas, or null or missing if this is the last page

NameAvailabilityResponse.description: Indicates whether a proposed resource name is available

nameAvailable.description: If true, the name is valid and available. If false, 'reason' describes why not.

reason.description: The reason why the name is not available, if nameAvailable is false

message.description: The localized reason why the name is not available, if nameAvailable is false

nextLink.description: URL to load the next page of projects
URL to load the next page of services
URL to load the next page of tasks

resourceType.description: The resource type, including the provider namespace

tier.description: The tier of the SKU, such as "Free", "Basic", "Standard", or "Premium"

capacity.description: A description of the scaling capacities of the SKU

nextLink.description: URL to load the next page of service SKUs

status.description: The machine-readable status, such as 'Initializing', 'Offline', 'Online', 'Deploying', 'Deleting', 'Stopped', 'Stopping', 'Starting', 'FailedToStart', 'FailedToStop' or 'Failed'

vmSize.description: The services virtual machine size, such as 'Standard_D2_v2'

supportedTaskTypes.description: The list of supported task types

values.description: The value of restrictions. If the restriction type is set to location. This would be different locations where the SKU is restricted.

ResourceSkuRestrictions.description: Describes scaling information of a SKU.

name.description: An invariant to describe the feature.

value.description: An invariant if the feature is measured by quantity.

meterID.description: Used for querying price from commerce.

quantity.description: The multiplier is needed to extend the base metered cost.

extendedUnit.description: An invariant to show the extended unit.

ResourceSkuCosts.description: Describes metadata for retrieving price info.

scaleType.description: The scale type applicable to the SKU.

ResourceSkuCapacity.description: Describes scaling information of a SKU.

resourceType.description: The type of resource the SKU applies to.

tier.description: Specifies the tier of DMS in a scale set.

family.description: The Family of this particular SKU.

kind.description: The Kind of resources that are supported in this SKU.

locations.description: The set of locations that the SKU is available.

apiVersions.description: The api versions that support this SKU.

capabilities.description: A name value pair to describe the capability.

restrictions.description: The restrictions because of which SKU cannot be used. This is empty if there are no restrictions.

value.description: The list of SKUs available for the subscription.

nextLink.description: The uri to fetch the next page of DMS SKUs. Call ListNext() with this to fetch the next page of DMS SKUs.

ResourceSkusResult.description: The DMS List SKUs operation response.
